page.title: 20Ecology in West Enfield.
page.content: Basically clay soil with some patches and out crops of glacial gravel.The land varies in height from 30m to 100m.The highest point being marked by the obelisk just off Ferny Hill. The areas of land not built upon are mainly farmland-intensively managed grassland.There are large areas of Urban Recreational Open Space.These consit of deciduous woodland and planted coniferous woodland. Footpaths. There are some miles of public footpaths throughout the area,some being used as nature trails.There are two well designed public golf courses. Local meterological weather station operated in Oakwood Park,results sent daily to the Met.Office. All this open space is within the London Green Belt and therefore there is practically no new building.
